fields.headline: This week's festival news
fields.bodyText: James Blake, Cat's Eyes and Danish four-piece When Saints Go Machine are the latest music additions at Latitude (14-17 Jul, Henham Park, Southwold, latitudefestival.co.uk) … While Black Lips, the Raveonettes, Damo Suzuki and Lydia Lunch make some noise at the muckier 1234 Festival (9 Jul, Shoreditch Park, N1, the1234shoreditch.com) … And there's more to Truck (22-24 Jul, Hill Farm, Steventon, thisistruck.com) than indie acts, with theatre from Oxford Playhouse, Roustabout and Rotozaza … COMING SOON Jamie Oliver's Big Feastival (Fri to 3 Jul, Clapham Common, jamieoliver.com/thebigfeastival) pulls in Red Snapper and comedian Richard Herring to entertain after eating in its kitchen hosted by Jay Rayner … NOW BOOKING Ellie Goulding and the Wombats join the Script and Two Door Cinema Club for Tennent's Vital, which also includes Eminem, Kaiser Chiefs and Odd Future (23-24 Aug, Ward Park, Bangor, North Down, tennentsvital.com) … And early bird tickets are on sale for the Futureheads-curated Split Festival featuring the Drums, the Charlatans, Frankie & The Heartstrings, Ganglians and B>E>A>K (17-18 Sep, Ashbrooke Sports Club, Sunderland, split.over9stores.co.uk).
